citation.article-title: Description of Persicirhabdus sediminis gen. nov., sp. nov., Roseibacillus ishigakijimensis gen. nov., sp. nov., Roseibacillus ponti sp. nov., Roseibacillus persicicus sp. nov., Luteolibacter pohnpeiensis gen. nov., sp. nov. and Luteolibacter algae sp. nov., six marine members of the phylum 'Verrucomicrobia', and emended descriptions of the class Verrucomicrobiae, the order Verrucomicrobiales and the family Verrucomicrobiaceae.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Luteolibacter algae sp. nov.
Luteolibacter algae (al′gae. L. fem. gen. n. algae of an alga, referring to the source of isolation of the type strain).
Main characteristics are the same as those given for the genus.
In addition, cells are 0.5–0.7 μm wide and 1.0–1.5 μm long.
Neither cellular gliding movement nor swarming growth is observed.
Colonies grown on 1/10-strength MA are circular, convex and pale yellow in colour.
The temperature range for growth is 4–37 °C, with optimal growth at 20–30 °C.
The pH range for growth is 6.5–8.5.
NaCl is not required for growth, but is tolerated up to 3 % (w/v).

Alkaline phosphatase, esterase lipase (C8) and naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase tests are positive, but leucine arylamidase, trypsin, acid phosphatase, α-glucosidase, esterase (C4), N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-galactosidase, β-galactosidase, valine arylamidase, lipase (C4), cystine arylamidase, chymotrypsin, β-glucuronidase, β-glucosidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase tests are negative.

Dextrin, Tween 80, l-arabinose, cellobiose, d-fructose, d-galactose, gentiobiose, d-glucose, d-lactose, lactulose, d-mannose, melibiose, d-psicose, monomethyl succinate, formic acid, d-galacturonic acid and 2,3-butanediol are oxidized.
The cell-wall peptidoglycan contains muramic acid and meso-diaminopimelic acid.
The G+C content of the genomic DNA of the type strain is 55.9 mol%.
The type strain is A5J-41-2T (=MBIC08320T =KCTC 22040T), which was isolated from an unidentified red alga.
